justification: “To assess broad personality dimensions, including unselfishness, we administered the six-factor HEXACO assessment of personality to all participants.”

The authors note that the HEXACO inventory “includes Honesty-Humility” and “dimensions similar to those captured by five-factor inventories (Emotionality, Extraversion, Agreeableness, Conscientiousness, and Openness to Experience).”
The same sentence lists Extraversion as one of the personality dimensions captured by the HEXACO measure.
Agreeableness is named among the dimensions assessed by the HEXACO instrument used in the study.
Conscientiousness is identified as one of the HEXACO dimensions measured in participants.
Openness to Experience is included in the set of traits the HEXACO assessment measures for this research.
Participants completed “a self-report measure of risk taking tendencies and perceptions (Domain-Specific Risk-Taking, DOSPERT).”
The same DOSPERT instrument is stated to assess participants’ “risk-perception.”
The battery included “a self-report measure of empathy (IRI, Interpersonal Reactivity Index).”

measured_by: Interpersonal Reactivity Index – Personal Distress subscale
justification: “Four groups … also scored lower on the Personal Distress subscale of the Interpersonal Reactivity Index,” showing this construct is taken from that specific IRI subscale.
Participants completed “a self-report measure on psychopathy (Psychopathic Personality Inventory-Short Form, PPI-SF).”
They also administered “the CRT that measures fast and intuitive versus slow and reflective deliberation during decision-making.”

measured_by: Social discounting task (binary choice, hyperbolic model)
justification: “We assessed social discounting using a validated online task… participants made 9 binary choices… allowing estimation of discounting rate (log k).”
